method.name: POST
method.doc: To configure a new authorization server instance using the supplied parameters, with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP POST command on the authorization server resource URI.

param.name: Authorization
param.doc: Basic Authentication header

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: inst_name
param.doc: This is the new instance name, which is a unique name that identifies the instance. Multiple instances can be installed on that same computer system. Each instance must have a unique name.

param.name: hostname
param.doc: The host name of the local host. This name is used when constructing the authorization server name.

param.name: authport
param.doc: The port on which authorization requests will be received.

param.name: adminport
param.doc: The port on which Security Verify Access administration requests will be received.

param.name: domain
param.doc: The Security Verify Access domain.

param.name: admin_id
param.doc: The Security Verify Access administrator name. This parameter is optional and will be set to sec_master if not specified.

param.name: admin_pwd
param.doc: The Security Verify Access administrator password.

param.name: addresses
param.doc: A json array containing a list of local addresses on which the authorization server will listen for requests.

param.name: ssl
param.doc: Whether or not to enable SSL between the Security Verify Access authorization server and the LDAP server. Accepted values are yes or no. This parameter is optional and will be set to no if not specified.

param.name: ssl_port
param.doc: The SSL port on which the LDAP server will be contacted. This parameter is required if SSL is set to yes. This parameter is ignored if ssl is set to no or not specified.

param.name: keyfile
param.doc: The name of the keyfile that will be used when communicating with the LDAP server over SSL. This parameter is required if ssl is set to yes. This parameter is ignored if ssl is set to no or not specified.

param.name: keyfile_label
param.doc: The label of the certificate within the keyfile to use.

response.doc: 200 ok {"id":"The name of the new authorization server instance"}
